JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Student Research Assistant in Finance at CBS
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Pension Research Centre (PeRCent) at the Department of Finance, Copenhagen Business School, is seeking a Student Research Assistant to support research in household finance. This role primarily involves analyzing firm and household-level data, covering areas such as savings, pensions, housing, investments, mortgages, and credit behavior.

About PeRCent
The mission of the Pension Research Centre (PeRCent) is to create interest and knowledge about pension issues and through research, teaching and intermediation to contribute to the development of the pension system in Denmark. The activities of PeRCent are funded jointly in cooperation between CBS and partners from the pension sector in Denmark. A key objective of the Pension Research Centre (PeRCent) is to make high-quality contributions in the pension research area, through publications in books and leading scientific journals in economics and finance.

Learn more about our work at www.cbs.dk/pct.

Your Role
As a Student Research Assistant, your tasks will include:
  • Conducting literature reviews to support research projects
  • Assisting with data collection and analysis
  • Preparing research presentations
  • Supporting PeRCent's educational and outreach activities

The role requires an average commitment of 15 hours per week, with flexibility during exam periods.

Your Profile
We are looking for a student in economics, finance, or a related field with:
  • A strong foundation in econometrics and statistics (experience with microeconometrics is a plus)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and familiarity with STATA and R
  • Strong academic performance, initiative, and an independent work approach

Salary & Employment Terms
Employment follows the HK collective agreement and the OAO-S agreement under the Danish Ministry of Finance. Salary ranges from DKK 140.57 to DKK 147.46 per hour, depending on education and prior clerical experience. A 15% pension contribution is included.

How to Apply
Submit your application via the "Apply Now" button by February 12, 2025. Your application must include:
  • Motivated application (max. 1 page)
  • CV
  • Grade transcript
  • Proof of enrollment at a Danish higher education institution
  • Documentation of previous clerical employment (if applicable)

Incomplete applications will not be considered. Interviews are expected to take place shortly after the deadline.

If you want to know more about the position please contact:

Center Coordinator Natalie Soudani
Email: nso.fi@cbs.dk.

Application due: 2/12/2025

WE TRANSFORM SOCIETY WITH BUSINESS

CBS is a globally recognised business school with deep roots in the Nordic socio-economic model. We have a broad focus on business and societal challenges of the 21st century. As such we have a full portfolio of high-quality disciplinary and interdisciplinary research and education that has equipped generations of professionals and leaders in the private sector and beyond.

Located at Frederiksberg, Denmark, the school has approx. 21.000 full and part-time students, 760 full-time faculty members, 210 PhD students and 680 administrative staff, and a full portfolio of Bachelor, Master’s, MBA/EMBA, PhD and Executive programmes delivered in English and Danish.

Our global profile carries the obligation to develop the transformational capabilities of students, graduates and business leaders via our educational activities and opportunities for lifelong learning. Complex challenges call for joint action, and therefore our strategy focuses on strengthening current and starting new partnerships with other sciences, the business community, authorities and civil society.
